original: Åkerhielm, Samuel Lars, friherre, generalmajor, Visby, f. 23i/10/87 i Sthlm av presid., frih. Lars A. o. Hulda Nyström. G. 13’ m. Margareta Reuterswärd, SLKSM. Barn: Ehsabeth f. 15, g. m. red. S. A. öström de Boussard. — AIHS 10-11, KHS ,13-15. Und:löjtn. v. Svea art:reg. 08, löjtn. 13, kapt. v. gen:staben 20, v. Svea art:reg. 26, åter v. gen ]Staben 28, major i gen :staben 29, lär. v. KHS 30, chef f. Norrb. art :-kår 3’1, överstelöjtn. 34, överste i armén 36 o. chef f. KHS 37, chef f. Svea art:reg. 40, stf. f. chef. f. försv:staben 41, stf. arm;éförd:chef v. H. förd. 41, gen :major o. mil :befälh. f. VH. milo tillika chef f. Gotl. marindistr. 42. Lär. i gen:stabstj. v. KHS 23-27 o. 28-31. Ordf. i Gotl. skarpskytte- o. jägargille sed. 46. KSOlkl, KFinlVRO, KTysk-ÖO, OffNedONO m sv, GV:s01M, CFBSM, LKrVA.
translated: Åkerhielm, Samuel Lars, Baron, Major General, Visby, born 23/10/87 in Stockholm, son of President, Baron Lars A. and Hulda Nyström. Married in 1913 to Margareta Reuterswärd, SLKSM. Children: Ehsabeth, born in 1915, married to editor S. A. öström de Boussard. — AIHS 10-11, KHS 13-15. Second Lieutenant in Svea Artillery Regiment in 1908, Lieutenant in 1913, Captain in the General Staff in 1920, back to Svea Artillery Regiment in 1926, back to the General Staff in 1928, Major in the General Staff in 1929, Instructor at KHS in 1930, Commander of Norrbotten Artillery Corps in 1931, Lieutenant Colonel in 1934, Colonel in the Army in 1936 and Commander of KHS in 1937, Commander of Svea Artillery Regiment in 1940, Deputy Chief of Defense Staff in 1941, Deputy Army Commander at Härnösand Defense District in 1941, Major General and Military Commander for VH. military area and Commander of Gotland Marine District in 1942. Instructor in General Staff Tactics at KHS from 1923-1927 and 1928-1931. Chairman of Gotland Sharpshooters and Hunters Association since 1946. Knight of the Order of the Seraphim, Knight of the Order of the Sword, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Officer of the Order of Orange-Nassau, and recipient of various other Swedish and foreign decorations.
